question_text: Why must memory modules be matched in type, speed, and capacity when implementing dual or quad channel configurations?
answer_options: To avoid invalidating the CPU cache
To allow the motherboard to use DMA
To prevent RAM overheating under load
To ensure the channels operate synchronously for optimal throughput
correct_answer: To ensure the channels operate synchronously for optimal throughput
explanation: Multi-channel memory systems require identical modules so that each channel can operate in lockstep, avoiding synchronization errors and maximizing data bandwidth.
